content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function given by <math alttext="f of x, equals, the fraction with numerator sine x, times cosine x, and denominator, open parenthesis, x squared, minus 4, close parenthesis, end fraction " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> on the closed interval <math alttext="open bracket, negative 2 pi, comma 2 pi, close bracket " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. On which of the following closed intervals is the function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> guaranteed by the Extreme Value Theorem to have an absolute maximum and an absolute minimum?

choices.label: <math alttext="open bracket, negative 2 pi, comma 2 pi, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open bracket, negative 2 comma 2, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open bracket, negative 1 comma 1, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open bracket, the fraction pi over 2, comma pi, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>,</mo><mi>π</mi><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="open bracket, negative 1 comma 1, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 5.2: Extreme Value Theorem, Global Versus Local Extrema, and Critical Points

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Provide reasons or rationales for solutions and conclusions.
